page.title: 16Crosskeys Rugby Club
page.content: Crosskeys can boast that it is the smallest village in Wales to have a first class rugby club - and 1985 is its centenary! The club began with just a field and the players had to wash in the local pubs after the game. In 1929 Lord Tredegar donated a local farmhouse to be converted to a clubhouse and bowling greens and tennis courts were also added. The present clubhouse was built in the early 1980's when the old one was demolished to make way for the new by-pass. A local man, Mr. Jack Tamlyn, played for the club for some years as a prop forward, joining in 1956. This was also the year when the last Crosskeys player - Rex Richards - won a full Welsh cap. It is the local opinion that the club's relative decline after this followed the decline of mining.
